TITLE: A record number of weddings are expected this year. How to save if you’re planning a trip down the aisle
SUMMARY: The most weddings since 1984 are expected to take place this year. If you're getting married, there are ways you can trim higher costs.

TITLE: The IRS has delivered more than 45 million tax refunds. This is the average payment
SUMMARY: The IRS has issued more than 45 million refunds worth almost $152 billion, as of March 11. Here's the average payment.

TITLE: Why high gas prices fall harder on lower earners
SUMMARY: Lower-income households spend more of their budgets on transportation and other necessities relative to other income groups, according to economists.

TITLE: Tax return backlog will ‘absolutely’ clear by end of 2022, says IRS Commissioner Charles Rettig
SUMMARY: IRS Commissioner Charles Rettig told House lawmakers he expects the backlog of tens of millions of unprocessed tax returns to clear by the end of 2022.

TITLE: Flexible hours allow employees at this company to fit work around their lives
SUMMARY: Americans crave flexibility in the workplace. This tech company has it. Here's how it works and how one employee used  it to her advantage.

TITLE: 46% of taxpayers plan to save their refunds this year
SUMMARY: So far, the average tax refund is $3,401, nearly 14% higher than last year, according to the IRS.

TITLE: Mom or dad moving in? What to know about becoming a caregiver
SUMMARY: If you are on the verge of becoming a caregiver for your older parent, here are some tips for managing the transition.

TITLE: Americans are pausing investments because of the Russia-Ukraine war. Here's what it could cost them
SUMMARY: The ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is hurting Americans' financial outlook, causing many to pause investing, according to a survey. Here's why that's a problem.

TITLE: Companies are raising consumer prices but you have to be a sleuth to detect it
SUMMARY: Some manufacturers are cutting the contents of packages. So-called shrinkflation is a way to increase consumer costs without adjusting the sticker price.

TITLE: Washington lawmakers are considering a gas tax holiday. Don't expect that to make a big dent in what you’re paying at the pump.
SUMMARY: Record high gas prices are stretching consumers. Yet experts say temporarily doing away with the federal gas tax won't do much.

TITLE: How the Federal Reserve's rate hike impacts student loan borrowers
SUMMARY: The Fed's recent interest rate hike will likely cause private student loans to get pricier, and for some, now is a good time to think about refinancing.

TITLE: Here’s why you should start paying off debt now — and how to get started
SUMMARY: The danger comes from interest rate hikes occurring several more times over the next few months and potentially in bigger chunks.

TITLE: Skyrocketing inflation is taking an ever bigger bite out of your paycheck
SUMMARY: Wages are rising, yet the prices consumers must pay for goods and services are rising even faster.

TITLE: If you're rejoining the workforce after retiring, here's how to handle your Medicare coverage
SUMMARY: It might make sense to drop your Medicare coverage and pick it up again later, depending on the options at your new job.

TITLE: Personal finance education is gaining momentum but economics is falling by the wayside, study finds
SUMMARY: Twenty-three states now require a personal finance course for graduation, according to the 2022 Survey of the States from the Council for Economic Education.

TITLE: Here's what the Fed's rate hike means for borrowers, savers and homeowners
SUMMARY: After holding rates near rock bottom for two years, the Fed is finally boosting its benchmark. Here's what that means for you.

TITLE: 96% of travelers want their vacation dollars to positively impact the place they visit, survey finds
SUMMARY: Nearly all travelers surveyed by booking platform Kind Traveler said it's important their travel dollars have a positive effect on the destination they visit.

TITLE: How the Fed's rate increase may affect your bond portfolio
SUMMARY: Market interest rates and bond prices typically move in opposite directions. Here's how the Federal Reserve's rate hike may affect your portfolio.

TITLE: There's still time to contribute to an IRA or an HSA for 2021. Why it makes sense to do so now
SUMMARY: The deadline for 2021 contributions to individual retirement accounts and health savings accounts is April 18, 2022 — tax day.

TITLE: Inflation is causing some older Americans to delay retirement plans, survey shows
SUMMARY: Inflation is causing some older Americans to postpone major life events, including retirement, according to a Nationwide survey.

TITLE: Two years ago stocks dropped 12% in a single day. Here are lessons investors learned that can still apply
SUMMARY: The initial onset of Covid-19 sent shocks through U.S. markets in 2020. Here's what investors can still take from that experience today.

TITLE: Work at a small employer? You likely pay high 401(k) fees
SUMMARY: The largest companies have 401(k) fees half those of small businesses, according to Morningstar. The difference can amount to a lot of money.

TITLE: Vanguard created big tax bills for target-date fund investors, lawsuit claims
SUMMARY: The investment manager triggered an exodus of money from target date funds that hurt some investors in taxable accounts, according to a lawsuit filed Monday.

TITLE: Eligible taxpayers can claim earned income tax credit in these states
SUMMARY: More than a dozen states added or expanded earned income tax credits in 2021. Here's what to know about this write-off for low to moderate earners.

TITLE: Why the Federal Reserve raises interest rates to combat inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers hit with higher prices due to inflation likely aren't looking forward to interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve. Here's why the Fed does that.

TITLE: Cybersecurity attacks surge as Ukraine-Russia war rages on. Here's how to protect yourself
SUMMARY: Here are the best ways to protect yourself as cybersecurity attacks become a very real threat around the world.

TITLE: Tom Brady cut his retirement short. If other retirees take his cue, it may reduce the labor shortage
SUMMARY: Tom Brady retired for 40 days before deciding to give it a go for another season playing for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Other retirees could take his lead.

TITLE: Inflation is costing U.S. households nearly $300 more a month. Here’s how to adjust your budget
SUMMARY: As prices continue to rise, you'll likely have to make adjustments to your lifestyle and budget. Here's what the experts say to do.

TITLE: Gold, silver ETF owners face 28% top tax rate on profits. That's higher than levies on stocks
SUMMARY: Exchange-traded funds backed by precious metals are considered collectibles for tax purposes. That may mean a higher tax bill on capital gains.

TITLE: One-third of job switchers took a pay cut for better work-life balance. How to prepare to live on a lower salary
SUMMARY: One-third of workers who switched jobs during the pandemic took a pay cut in exchange for better work and life balance, according to Prudential.
